intro: Caesulia lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Caesulia lancifolia is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates.
